name: Victoria Memorial
description: A grand marble building dedicated to Queen Victoria, surrounded by sprawling gardens.
history: Built between 1906–1921 to commemorate Queen Victoria's 25-year reign in India. Designed by William Emerson in Indo-Saracenic revivalist style.
personal_tips: The best time for photos is just before sunset when the white marble glows gold. Don't miss the light and sound show in the evening.
past_events: Hosted the G20 cultural dinner in 2023.

name: Howrah Bridge
description: An iconic cantilever bridge spanning the Hooghly River, a symbol of Kolkata.
history: Commissioned in 1943, it was the third-longest cantilever bridge at the time. It has no nuts and bolts; it's held together by rivets.
personal_tips: Walk across it early morning to see the city wake up. Avoid peak hours if you dislike crowds.

name: Indian Museum
description: The oldest and largest museum in India, housing rare antiques, armor, and fossils.
history: Founded in 1814 by the Asiatic Society of Bengal. It has a rare collection of Egyptian mummies.
personal_tips: It's huge! Focus on the Archaeology and Art sections if you are short on time. The Egyptian mummy is a must-see.

name: College Street Coffee House
description: A historic cafe that has been the hub of Kolkata's intelligentsia for decades.
history: Originally Albert Hall, founded in 1876. It became the meeting place for poets, artists, and revolutionaries like Satyajit Ray and Amartya Sen.
personal_tips: Don't expect quick service or luxury. Go for the 'adda' (chat) and nostalgia. Try the Cold Coffee and Mutton Afgani.
past_events: Countless literary debates and book launches.

name: Kumartuli
description: A traditional potters' quarter where clay idols of gods and goddesses are made.
history: The settlement dates back to the British era. It is famous for sculpting idols for Durga Puja.
personal_tips: Visit a month before Durga Puja (September) to see the idols being painted. Ask permission before taking close-up photos of artisans.

name: Prinsep Ghat
description: A beautiful Palladian porch on the banks of the Hooghly River.
history: Built in 1841 in memory of James Prinsep, a scholar who deciphered the Brahmi script.
personal_tips: Take a private boat ride on the river at sunset. It's very romantic and offers great views of the Vidyasagar Setu.

name: Dakshineswar Kali Temple
description: A famous Hindu navaratna temple located on the eastern bank of the Hooghly River.
history: Built in 1855 by Rani Rashmoni. The mystic Ramakrishna Paramahansa served as its priest.
personal_tips: The queue can be very long. Tuesdays and Saturdays are busiest. Use the Skywalk for easy access from the station.

name: Park Street
description: The street that never sleeps, famous for its restaurants, pubs, and colonial charm.
history: Was the center of Kolkata's nightlife in the swinging 60s. Home to iconic eateries like Flurys and Moulin Rouge.
personal_tips: Visit during Christmas! The lighting is spectacular. Try the Chelo Kebab at Peter Cat.

name: Marble Palace
description: A palatial nineteenth-century mansion in North Kolkata, famous for its marble walls and floors.
history: Built in 1835 by Raja Rajendra Mullick. It houses a private zoo and a collection of Western art.
personal_tips: You need a permit from the West Bengal Tourism Information Bureau 24 hours in advance. Photography is strictly prohibited.

name: South Park Street Cemetery
description: An 18th-century non-church cemetery with massive gothic tombs.
history: Opened in 1767, it is one of the earliest non-church cemeteries in the world. It houses the grave of Henry Louis Vivian Derozio.
personal_tips: It's surprisingly peaceful. Great for history buffs and photographers. Can be a bit spooky!

name: Eco Park
description: The biggest urban park in India, featuring themed areas like the Seven Wonders of the World.
history: Inaugurated in 2012 in New Town to promote eco-tourism.
personal_tips: It's massive. Rent a cycle or take the toy train. The Japanese Garden is very serene.

name: Kalighat Kali Temple
description: One of the 51 Shakti Peethas, dedicated to the goddess Kali.
history: The current temple was built in 1809, but the site has been sacred for centuries. The name 'Calcutta' is said to be derived from Kalighat.
personal_tips: Beware of aggressive pandas (priests). Keep your belongings safe. The morning aarti is powerful.

name: Belur Math
description: The headquarters of the Ramakrishna Math and Mission.
history: Founded by Swami Vivekananda in 1897. The architecture fuses Hindu, Christian, and Islamic motifs to symbolize unity of religions.
personal_tips: Sit by the river bank in the evening. It is incredibly peaceful. Silence is strictly maintained.

name: New Market
description: A historic shopping destination that sells everything from clothes to cheese.
history: Opened in 1874 as Sir Stuart Hogg Market. It was the first municipal market in Kolkata.
personal_tips: Bargain hard! Visit Nahoum's Bakery for their rich fruit cake. It's a maze, so try not to get lost.

name: Jorasanko Thakur Bari
description: The ancestral home of the Tagore family.
history: Birthplace of Nobel laureate Rabindranath Tagore. It is now a museum dedicated to his life and works.
personal_tips: A must for literature lovers. The light and sound show is decent.

name: Science City
description: The largest science center in the Indian subcontinent, featuring interactive exhibits and a space theatre.
history: Inaugurated in 1997, it was developed by the National Council of Science Museums to popularize science.
personal_tips: Great for kids. The Time Machine ride and the 3D show are popular. Plan for at least 3-4 hours.

name: Nicco Park
description: An amusement park often called the 'Disneyland of West Bengal'.
history: Opened in 1991, it was the first amusement park in India to achieve ISO 9001 certification.
personal_tips: Buy the package ticket that includes all rides to save money. The water park 'Wet-O-Wild' is great in summer.

name: Alipore Zoo
description: India's oldest zoological park, home to a wide variety of animals including the Royal Bengal Tiger.
history: Opened in 1876 by Edward VII. It was home to Adwaita, a giant tortoise that lived for over 250 years.
personal_tips: Visit in winter to see the migratory birds. It gets very crowded on holidays.

name: Eden Gardens
description: One of the most iconic cricket stadiums in the world, known as the 'Mecca of Indian Cricket'.
history: Established in 1864. It is the oldest and second-largest cricket stadium in India.
personal_tips: Watching a match here is an electric experience. On non-match days, you might need permission to enter the stands.
past_events: 1987 World Cup Final, 2016 T20 World Cup Final

name: St. Paul's Cathedral
description: A magnificent Anglican cathedral known for its Indo-Gothic architecture.
history: Completed in 1847, it was the first Episcopal Church in Asia. The original steeple fell in an earthquake in 1934 and was rebuilt.
personal_tips: It is very quiet and peaceful inside. The stained glass windows are beautiful. Midnight Mass on Christmas Eve is special.

name: Nakhoda Masjid
description: The largest mosque in Kolkata, capable of accommodating 10,000 devotees.
history: Built in 1926 by Abdar Rahim Osman, a shipping magnate. Its architecture is influenced by Akbar's tomb in Sikandra.
personal_tips: Visit during Eid to see it lit up. The area around it serves amazing Mughlai food.

name: Botanical Gardens
description: A massive garden famous for the Great Banyan Tree, which is over 250 years old.
history: Founded in 1787 by Colonel Robert Kyd. It was originally known as the Company Bagh.
personal_tips: It is located in Shibpur (Howrah), across the river. The Great Banyan Tree looks like a forest by itself. Wear comfortable walking shoes.

name: Mother House
description: The headquarters of the Missionaries of Charity and the tomb of Mother Teresa.
history: Established by Mother Teresa in 1950. It serves as a place of pilgrimage for people from all over the world.
personal_tips: The museum is small but very moving. It is a place of absolute silence and reflection.

name: Birla Planetarium
description: The largest planetarium in Asia and the second largest in the world.
history: Inaugurated in 1963 by Jawaharlal Nehru. Its architecture is modeled on the Buddhist Stupa at Sanchi.
personal_tips: Check the show timings and language (English/Hindi/Bengali) before you go. The cosmic collision show is good.

name: Millennium Park
description: A private park along the Hooghly River, offering great views of the Howrah Bridge.
history: Opened in 1999 as part of the Kolkata Riverside Beautification Project.
personal_tips: Good for a casual evening stroll. The food court offers decent snacks. The view of the lit-up Howrah Bridge is excellent.
